page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY BURY AREA
page.content: The area was first visited by men of the New Stone Age.In 61AD the area rose up in revolt against the Romans.The Abbey was founded and sponsored by Duke Ailwyn in 969AD.It was during this time that the motte and baille castle was built on what is now known as Booths Hill.The Great Whyte and the Little Whyte were both canals that carried barges carrying Barnack stone.A leper hospital was opened at the bottom of what is now known as Byggnygwey.The Abbey was sold to Richard Williams for Â£4663 4s 2d in 1540.The outbreak of the Black Death occurred in 1666.In 1737 Ramsey and the local area was bought by William Fellowes.In 1852/4 the canal down the Great Whyte was covered over at a cost of Â£2000.A police station was built in 1853.
